longDef.en: a period of seven days, especially either from Monday to Sunday or from Sunday to Saturday
longDef.cn: 星期，周（尤指从星期一到星期日或从星期日到星期六）

examples.en: We go to the cinema about once a week.
examples.cn: 我们大约一周去看一次电影。

examples.en: Will you be going to next week's class?
It usually takes about four weeks to get the forms processed.
examples.cn: 处理这些表格通常需要4周左右的时间。

examples.en: Don't do anything strenuous for a week or two.
examples.cn: 一两周之内不要干任何重活儿。

examples.en: It'll be weeks (= several weeks) before the flood damage is cleaned up.
examples.cn: 清理洪水造成的破坏要好几周时间。

longDef.en: the five days from Monday to Friday, the usual working period for many people
longDef.cn: 工作周（星期一到星期五）

examples.en: We're usually too tired to go out much during the week.
examples.cn: 工作日期间我们通常很累，没有精力去参加太多的社交活动。

longDef.en: one week after the day mentioned

examples.en: The first performance of the play is a week (from) today/tomorrow.
examples.cn: 这出戏的首演将在从今天／明天算起的一周后举行。

examples.en: Our holiday starts a week on Saturday.
examples.cn: 我们的假期将从下周六开始。

examples.en: She has to go back to see the doctor Friday week.

longDef.en: one week before the day mentioned

examples.en: It was his birthday a week ago last Friday.
The problems with the TV started a week last Monday.
examples.cn: 从上星期一开始电视就出问题了。

longDef.en: the amount of hours spent working during a week or the number of days on which a person works
longDef.cn: 每周的工作小时数；每周的工作天数

examples.en: A lot of farm workers work a six-day week.
examples.cn: 很多农场的工人每周工作6天。

longDef.en: each week during a period of time

examples.en: We could see his health deteriorate week by week.
examples.cn: 每一周我们都能看到他的健康状况在恶化。

longDef.en: regularly or continuously for many weeks
longDef.cn: 一周又一周地;一连数周

examples.en: I go to aerobics three times a week, week in, week out.
examples.cn: 我一连几个星期每星期都去做三次有氧健身操。
